page.title: 15Trimley Traditional Beliefs
page.content: Trimley has got two parish churches next door to each other in the churchyard. People say that they were built by two sisters who fell out and refused to go to the same church so each one built her own. No one seems to know why there are two churches together but the Rector thinks they were built on the highest land in the villages. A local historian says the "sisters" may have been religious houses,perhaps a monastery and a nunnery,each needing its own chapel. Another local belief is that there was once a tunnel between Alston Hall and Grimston Hall. The Land Agent told us that a line can be seen from the air,where the tunnel had fallen in. We found no trace of this. Tunnel stories are often connected with smuggling and both houses are well placed near the river where smuggling went on.
